feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 2:22PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snowfall Expected for the Eastern Interior and Alaska Range through Tuesday... The forecast continues to be on track with significant slow totals in the Eastern Alaska Range, including the Richardson Highway Corridor through Tuesday morning. Snow is continuing to move east today and is on track to gradually diminish from west to east
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Chatanika River Valley; Delta Junction; Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp; Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Fortymile Country; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; Northern Denali Borough; Southern Denali Borough; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley; Upper Tanana Valley; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 2 inches along the Richardson Highway from Paxon north to Isabel Pass. Additional snow accumulation up to 2 inches along the Glenn Highway and Tok Cutoff. North winds gusting to 40 mph

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 10:02AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RESUSPENDED ASH FROM KATMAI-NOVARUPTA EXPECTED OVER KODIAK ISLAND THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT... Strong northwesterly winds up to 40 mph have developed across Shelikof Strait. These winds are resuspending ash from the 1912 Katmai-Novarupta eruption. The villages of Karluk and Larsen Bay are most likely to be impacted. Ash is currently north of Akhiok,

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued October 02 at 2:02AM AKDT until October 03 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and Blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 02 at 2:02AM AKDT until October 03 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS

entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 1:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow and blowing snow in the Brooks Range into Monday... An arctic front moving through the Brooks Range will bring snow and blowing snow. 2 to 4 inches of snow is expected through Monday, along with northerly winds 15 to 30 mph which will reduce visibility. Use caution if traveling in the area.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Arctic Plains; Central Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Fremont and northeastern Custer Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 429 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Florence, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 02 at 9:29AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .Prior rainfall and weather conditions will keep the Saint Johns River at Astor in Moderate Flood Stage. entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued October 02 at 3:44PM MDT until October 02 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL EDDY COUNTY... At 344 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. The expected rainfall rate is 2.5 to 3.5 inches in 1 hour. Loop Bypass Road in west Carlsbad is closed due to flash flooding.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued October 02 at 2:31PM MDT until October 02 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL EDDY COUNTY... At 231 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain. Spotters have reported flash flooding across U.S. Highway 285. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued October 02 at 2:28PM MDT until October 02 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTH CENTRAL EDDY COUNTY... At 228 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Walnut Canyon have moved north out of the canyon. However, flash flooding in the canyon is expected to continue for the next hour or two.
